intro.speaker: Lissa
intro.line: I told you—it's getting dark already! ...Ech! And now the bugs are out! Noisy, disgusting bugs that buzz around and crawl all over and bite you when—Agh! Won goph in mah mouph! Blech! Ptooey!

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Aw, come on now, Lissa. Hardship builds character. Want to help me gather firewood?

intro.speaker: Lissa
intro.line: Tpht! Tpht! Yeeeeeuck! ...I think I swallowed it... I'll pass on finding firewood, thanks. I think I've built QUITE enough character for one day!

intro.speaker: Robin
intro.line: We should probably think about food. I don't know about you, but I'm starving.

intro.speaker: Frederick
intro.line: Yes, I should think a little hunting and gathering is in order. Now, who wants to clear a campsite?

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Mmm... It's been too long since I last had bear meat. Delicious! ...What's wrong, Lissa? Dig in.

intro.speaker: Lissa
intro.line: Pass! ...Gods, couldn't you spear us an animal normal people eat for once? I mean, come on! Who eats bear?! You're meddling with the food chain. Right, Robin? ...Uh, Robin?

intro.speaker: Robin
intro.line: *Munch, munch, slurp*

intro.speaker: Lissa
intro.line: *Sigh* I suppose a person would enjoy just about anything after not eating for days...

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Just eat it, Lissa. Meat is meat.

intro.speaker: Lissa
intro.line: Since when does meat smell like old boots?! Wait, I take that back—boots smell better!

intro.speaker: Frederick
intro.line: Every experience makes us stronger, milady. Even those we don't enjoy.

intro.speaker: Lissa
intro.line: Really? Then why don't I see YOU eating, Frederick?

intro.speaker: Frederick
intro.line: Me? Oh, well... I'm not hungry. I...I had a large lunch! Yes, quite.

intro.speaker: Lissa
intro.line: Yeah right, Frederick!

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: ...Huh?

intro.speaker: Lissa
intro.line: *Yawn* What's wrong, Big Brother?

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Sorry, I didn't mean to wake you, but... Something is amiss...

intro.speaker: Lissa
intro.line: Define "something".

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: I'm not sure... I think I'll have a look around.

intro.speaker: Lissa
intro.line: Not alone, you won't! I'm coming too.

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Heh. Thanks, Lissa.

intro.speaker: Lissa
intro.line: It sure is dark. ...And quiet. Where did the birds go?

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Something is wrong here...

intro.speaker: Lissa
intro.line: Aaah! Chrom!

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Gods, what— Agh! What is this madness?! Lissa, stay close!

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Lissa, run.

intro.speaker: Lissa
intro.line: Huh?

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: I mean it! Go!

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Hey! This way!

intro.speaker: Lissa
intro.line: Chrom, what IS that?!

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Lissa, you'd better stand back.

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Lissa!

intro.speaker: Marth
intro.line: Help!

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: ...Right!

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: ...Quite an entrance. What's your name?

intro.speaker: Frederick
intro.line: Milord! Milady! Are you hurt?

intro.speaker: Lissa
intro.line: Frederick! Robin!

intro.speaker: Robin
intro.line: Are such horrific creatures commonplace in these lands?

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: They're not from Ylisse, I promise you that.

intro.speaker: Frederick
intro.line: No one is injured, then? Thank the gods...

intro.speaker: Lissa
intro.line: Thank the masked man who saved me! If it wasn't for him, I'd be... Hey, where did he go?

intro.speaker: Frederick
intro.line: We can worry about him later, AFTER we put these...things...to the blade. Eyes open, now. We know nothing about this enemy.

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Right.

battle.speaker: Robin
battle.line: Then we should take shelter in them whenever possible. No doubt they will offer distinct advantages in battle.

battle.speaker: Sully
battle.line: Captain Chrom! Wait! I'm coming! ...Agh, I knew I shouldn'ta left 'em. All right, you ash-faced freaks! Which one of ya wants to try my lance on for size first? I know just the spot for it: shoved right up your—

battle.speaker: Virion
battle.line: Life may be long, but attraction is fleeting! Would you leave me in your sweet dust? Leave war to the warriors, dear bird! A beauty such as you need wage only love.

battle.speaker: Virion
battle.line: Ha! Is the lady intrigued? Of course you are—it's only natural. I am myth and legend! I am he who strides large across history's greatest stage! The man who puts the "arch" in "archer"! My name, dear lady, is Vi—

battle.speaker: Sully
battle.line: Sorry, Ruffles—no time for this. Onward!

battle.speaker: Virion
battle.line: Virion! ...Er, my name. It's Virion. W-wait! Where are you going? Pray, at least tell me your name!

battle.speaker: Virion
battle.line: "Sully"! How divine! A starkly beautiful name, as befits its owner, truly. Will you marry me, my dearest Sully?

battle.speaker: Sully
battle.line: Will I what now? Oh wait, I get it... This is a joke. And when I put my boot through your face—that's the punch line.

battle.speaker: Virion
battle.line: I realize my manly figure and noble bearing can be overwhelming. 'Tis common! So please, don't feel pressured to answer right a—

battle.speaker: Virion
battle.line: OOF! G-goodness, but those shapely legs certainly can kick, can't they... P-please, milady! Allow me to accompany you, at least! Mine is a cold, empty world without you. I shall be your most willing servant, and you, in turn, will give my life purpose...

battle.speaker: Sully
battle.line: *Sigh* Fine... Anything to shut you up. ...What? Stop staring at me like that!

battle.speaker: Virion
battle.line: Goddesses and gentlemen, might I have your attention? I, as it happens, am an archer! ...The archest of archers, in fact. As such, I attack most effectively from a distance. So kindly keep me one step away from peril, if you would!

end.speaker: Frederick
end.line: It seems all the creatures are vanquished. This young man took care of the others.

end.speaker: Lissa
end.line: Um, I never got to thank you...for before. So...thank you. You were very brave.

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: You saved my sister's life. My name is Chrom. Might I ask yours?

end.speaker: "Marth"
end.line: You may call me Marth.

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: Marth? After the heroic king of old? You certainly fight like a hero. Where did you learn your way with a sword?

end.speaker: "Marth"
end.line: I'm not here to talk about me. This world teeters at the brink of a horrible calamity. What you saw tonight was but a prelude. You have been warned.

end.speaker: Lissa
end.line: Huh? What's teetering where now? Hey, wait!

end.speaker: Robin
end.line: Not much for conversation, is he?

end.speaker: Frederick
end.line: It appears his skills lie elsewhere. I wager we'll hear his name again... But for now I'm more concerned about the capital. We should make haste.

end.speaker: Robin
end.line: So this is Ylisstol, capital of Ylisse... I've never seen so many people!

end.speaker: Frederick
end.line: It appears the capital was spared the chaos we encountered, thank the gods. I see no evidence of the great quake. It must've been limited to the forest.

end.speaker: Lissa
end.line: Well, that's a relief!

end.speaker: Old Villager
end.line: Look! The exalt has come to see us!

end.speaker: Robin
end.line: The exalt is your ruler, yes?

end.speaker: Frederick
end.line: Yes. Her name is Lady Emmeryn.

end.speaker: Robin
end.line: Is it safe for her to walk among commoners like this?

end.speaker: Frederick
end.line: The exalt is a symbol of peace—Ylisse's most prized quality. Long ago, at the dawn of our age, the fell dragon tried to destroy the world. But the first exalt joined forces with the divine dragon and laid the beast low. Exalt Emmeryn reminds us all of the peace we fought for then.

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: With Plegia poking at our borders, the people need her. She's a calming presence, when some might otherwise call for war.

end.speaker: Robin
end.line: Then the Ylissean people are indeed lucky to have her.

end.speaker: Lissa
end.line: She's also the best big sister anyone could ask for!

end.speaker: Robin
end.line: Yes, I imagine she... Wait, what? She's your... But wouldn't that make you and Chrom...

end.speaker: Frederick
end.line: The prince and princess of the realm, yes. You remember Chrom's name and not this?

end.speaker: Robin
end.line: You said you were "shepherds"!

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: And so we are...in a manner of speaking. We just have a LOT of sheep.

end.speaker: Robin
end.line: C-Chrom... I mean, Prince Chrom! Sire! Forgive my dreadful manners!

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: Just Chrom is fine. I've never been much for formalities.

end.speaker: Robin
end.line: The prince and princess... That explains why Frederick tolerates all the teasing, eh?

end.speaker: Frederick
end.line: Indeed. Oh, the sacrifices I make for the good of the realm...

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: It looks like Emm is returning to the palace. Would you like to meet her?

end.speaker: Emmeryn
end.line: Chrom! Lissa! Welcome home. Oh, and good day, Frederick. How fared you all?

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: Well—we shouldn't have any bandit problems for a while.

end.speaker: Emmeryn
end.line: Wonderful. And our people?

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: Safe as they can be, Emm. But we still need to watch the borders. The brigands crossed over from Plegia.

end.speaker: Phila
end.line: Forgive me, milord. My pegasus knights should have intercepted them.

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: No, Phila. Your duty was here, with the exalt.

end.speaker: Lissa
end.line: And besides, we had plenty of help!

end.speaker: Emmeryn
end.line: Ah, you speak of your new companion here?

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: This is Robin. He/She fought bravely with us against the brigands. I've decided to make him/her a Shepherd.

end.speaker: Emmeryn
end.line: It sounds as though Ylisse owes you a debt of gratitude, Robin.

end.speaker: Robin
end.line: Not at all, milady!

end.speaker: Frederick
end.line: Forgive me, Your Grace, but I must speak. Robin claims to have lost his/her memory, but it is only that: a claim. We cannot rule out the possibility that he/she is a brigand himself or even a Plegian spy.

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: Frederick!

end.speaker: Emmeryn
end.line: Yet you allowed him/her into the castle, Chrom. Does this man/woman have your trust?

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: Yes. He/She risked his/her life for our people. That's good enough for me.

end.speaker: Emmeryn
end.line: Well then, Robin... It seems you've earned Chrom's faith, and as such you have mine as well.

end.speaker: Robin
end.line: Milady.

end.speaker: Emmeryn
end.line: But thank you, Frederick, for your prudence, as always. Chrom and Lissa are blessed to have so tireless a guardian. I do hope they remember to mention that from time to time...

end.speaker: Frederick
end.line: They occasionally express something akin to gratitude, Your Grace. Phila. I assume you've heard about the deathly creatures we encountered, yes?

end.speaker: Phila
end.line: Yes, milord. They've been sighted all across Ylisse.

end.speaker: Emmeryn
end.line: Chrom, we are about to hold council. I was hoping you could join us.

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: Of course.

end.speaker: Lissa
end.line: I think that's our cue, Robin! C'mon, there's a place I want to show you.
